definition: the back cover of a book
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: For the first time the cover is a wrap-around.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底的图画是连在一起的，这还是第一次。

sentences.english: Oops, I have gone too far. This is the back of the magazine.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我扯太远了，这是这本书的封底。

sentences.english: Open the book so that the first and last pages and the core of the spine are facing up.
sentences.chinese: 将书打开，封面封底和书脊朝上。

sentences.english: The covers were of heavy weight, buff-coloured calendered paper with two holes punched in the edges.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底是重磅的米色道林纸，边上打了两个眼。

sentences.english: The covers is heavy beige Dowling, have two holes with edge.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底是重磅的米色道林纸，边上打了两个眼。

sentences.english: Likewise, the utility model satisfies a procedure of paper tubes bottom closing and gunpowder injection for firecracker manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 同样满足鞭炮生产厂家把纸筒封底和灌入火药的工序。

sentences.english: Read the back cover and the introduction .
sentences.chinese: 读一下书的封底和简介。

definition: dust jacket (of a book)/protective cover/document seal
book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2 liu4 kai1] is roughly A4)/abbr. to 開|开[kai1]
binding and layout (of a book etc)
